Subject: [sfraves] [BSP] Tonight!! Filter Freqs out at Anu with [a]pendics.shuffle [LIVE Tech__?]

If you haven't heard L.A.'s [a]pendics.shuffle yet, here's your chance
tonight. Only $5 at the cool as bleep Anu, downtown SF. Bio and music
DL below.

I have a few GL spots available for entry before 10:30 for all you
good time hard up techoo seekers.

PM if interested.

SK

:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

West Coast minimal techno label Adjunct-Audio label features founders
[a]pendics.shuffle and Konstantin Gabbro (Los Angeles) hit Anu, Friday
July 27 with a special $5 show.

Plus opening DJ sets by Filter femmes Saya+ Solekandi

:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

Kenneth James Gibson aka [a]pendics.shuffle (Adjunct, Los Angeles)

Since the late 1990's Kenneth James Gibson has produced countless
releases under multiple monikers, including Eight Frozen Modules,
[a]pendics.shuffle, KJ Gibbs and dubLoner. Since December alone,
Mr.Gibson has produced nine new releases for Adjunct, Orac, Mo's Ferry
and Lessizmore that firmly establish this LA producer as one of most
prolific forces in experimental, "computer funk" dance music
production.

Apendics.Shuffle Liveset DL here:
http://www.adjunct-audio.com/KJG/apendics.shuffle_LA_djset_2007.mp3

One of the early West Coast evangelists of minimal techno, Konstantin
Gabbro is the founder of Seattle's homegrown Orac Records, a label
that launched Bruno Pronsato and Kenneth James Gibson's
[a]pendics.shuffle moniker into the realm of the international
techorati.

In 2003 Konstantin moved down the Pacific Coast to Los Angeles where
he and Gibson (KJG) launched another label =96 Adjunct - a forward
thinking techno outlet that releases critically acclaimed collectibles
from names such as John Tejada, Pheek and newcomer mystery man
Altiply.

A combination of Gabbro's well-schooled knowledge of deconstructed,
experimental techno with Gibson's mojo-laden epic Live PA sets goes
well beyond their description of "funky computer music".

More information:
www.adjunct-audio.com
www.myspace.com/filtersf
http://www.anu-bar.com/

Homepage
http://www.freqbox.net

---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: [sfraves] New Mix - Prince of Darkness

------=_Part_8488_6205432.1185555347175
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

I started working on this mix in December of 2002, when I first got decks
and started learning how to play. I've done a lot of different versions of
this and played with many different playlists, but I think this one is good
enough that I can put it to rest and now think about it any more. It's quite
a bit harder than the liquid funk I usually play. To those who say I play
gay dnb, this is my fuck you. Comments are appreciated. Hope you like it.
:-)

Check out the thread on groundscore:
http://www.groundscore.net/board/viewtopic.php?t=33631&start=0&postdays=0&postorder=asc&highlight=

(320kbps|mp3|134mb)
http://pestilence.short-b.us/mp3/01%20Prince%20of%20Darkness%20%5b07-01-2007%5d.mp3
(128kbps|mpe|56mb)
http://pestilence.short-b.us/mp3/01%20Prince%20of%20Darkness%20%5b07-01-2007%5d%20128kbps.mp3

Running Time: 58:33
Tracklist:
01: Blame - Reign of Fire
02: Kryptic Minds and Leon Switch - Blue Print
03: Phobia - Creep
04: Total Science - Squash - Gridlok Remix
05: Prolix - Free Fall
06: Morphesis - The Script
07: Black Sun Empire - Bombrun
08: Hydro, Mindscape, Jade - Black Lotus
09: D Kay - Galaxy
10: Messiah - Body Count
11: Calyx - Ascension
12: Noisia & Mayhem, Pacific - Centepod
13: DJ Kontrol - Force Field
14: Ed Rush & Optical - Cannibal Run
15: Noisa & Mayhem - Lockjaw
16: J-Majick & Wickaman - Share the Blame
17: K.O.T.P. - Daredevil
18: Noisia - Absolom
19: DC Breaks - Horizon
20: Black Sun Empire - Arrakis
21: Eclipse - Turbulence
22: Spirit - Scrabble
23: Vicious Circle - Between the Lines
24: Fission - Pyramids
25: Silver - Angry & Bitter
26: John B - Blandwagon Poos
27: Evancipation - Track 04
28: Photek - C-Note
29: Silver - Up Wave
30: Digital - Deadline
31: TC feat Jakes - Deep - Radio Edit

Subject: Re: [sfraves] btw, DAFT PUNK!!!!

I'm a big fan of the Indian Rock area over by Sterling, and any scenic 
pull-off on Grizzly Peak, as well as the one kiddy kinda exploratorium type 
spot near Lawrence Berkeley Labs. Good shit, GREAT views. On a clear day 
from that spot, u can see almost allthe way down to the Dumbarton Bridge, 
and all the way up to the Richmond Bridge....

And when there's fog in SF, it looks like its floating in the clouds.

Here's to good times!!!

dangrsmind@yahoo.com wrote: Yup.  And there aren't many where I haven't done at least one of the following: smoked, drinked, puked, or had sex. 

Specifically at the park across form the Rose Garden, Codornices, I recall drinking & smoking while an ex girlfriend showed off her new pet racoon.  She got upset when some people tried to get the racoon high.

There was also this really hot girl there I liked at the time but who turned out to be gay. Damn it.

Ah memories...

Peter

Subject: [sfraves] So is it worth $75 to see Tiesto...

--Apple-Mail-1--962697121
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=US-ASCII;
	delsp=yes;
	format=flowed

... with the 1015 and ruby sky people involved?

My roommate is trying to convince me to go to the Tiesto thing  
tonight.  I actually wouldn't mind seeing Tiesto, though I'm not  
about to buy into the hype and mess myself over him.  And, truth be  
told, if it were a pure Skills party I might even have been lined up  
to get a presale the first day they came out.

But now, with the presales long gone, and Skills having invited the  
1015 and ruby sky people along to run the party with them (And  
therefore have the clubber element there, instead of ravers...); I'm  
having a hard time convincing myself that it's worth the $75.

So is it really?  At this point, I'm tending towards no and thinking  
of looking for something smaller and cheaper and not clubby.  But  
I've only ever gone to the real Skills parties, not the ones where  
they let 1015/spundae or ruby sky tag along; so, despite the bad  
things I've heard about the mix, I've no real basis for forming an  
opinion.


cya,
john


--Apple-Mail-1--962697121--

Subject: Re: [sfraves] (nrr) QOD (Tue)

I once passed Dr. Demento on the 101 near Sacramento about 12 years ago.

He had vanity license plates on his car and a little bit of semaphoric 
hand-signalling on my part as I drove alongside him confirmed his identity.

Here are the lyrics you're looking for as well as a mash-up, GIYF:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S_fc6QOHHX8

> Religion And Politics Ya-Ta-Ta! Ya-Ta-Ta!
> Writ and Spake by Scott Beach
>
>     * available on: original 45 on Captain Records SAC-160, 1976
>     * Dr. Demento's Dementia Royale, Rhino RNLP 010, 1980
>
> The original 45 has an uncensored version as well as a censored 
> version which uses sound effects to censor nine words: crap, shit (all 
> 5 times), bitch, bastard, and ass. The LP is censored with different 
> effects, and only censors six words: shit (all 5 times) and ass.
>
> Religion and politics
> Often make some people
> Lose all perspective and
> Give way to ranting and raving and
> Carrying on like emotional children.
> They either refuse to discuss it with reason,
> Or else they prefer argumentum ad hominum,
> Which is a hell of a way to conduct a discussion.
>
> Well, anyhow, not long ago,
> I was talking about the elections,
> And how the campaigns were ignoring the issues,
> And sticking instead to invective and personal crap
> That had nothing to do with the substantive problems of running a 
> government,
> Which is all true, as you know
> If you followed the speeches and so-called debates of the candidates.
>
> Anyhow, one of the guys I was talking with
> Said not a word in the whole conversation
> Except at the end when he suddenly chuckled
> And said we were all full of shit,
> And why didn't we go live in Russia or China
> If that was the way we all hated the United States Of America.
>
> Next thing you know the whole blooming discussion
> Was more like a brawl,
> And the epithets flew thick and fast,
> And the noise was incredible.
> Someone said "son of a bitch",
> And I think he said "bastard".
> I couldn't be sure, it was all so confusing.
>
> Well, anyhow, I was attempting
> To get it all back on a rational level.
> I tried, for example, to talk to the one who had started it all,
> And I asked him just what did he mean we were all full of shit.
> Was he making a statement of fact as he knew it,
> And where was his documentation to back up his claim?
> I think Socrates would've been proud of the way I refuted his argument.
> That is, I tried to refute it,
> But all he could offer by way of rebuttal was more of the same
> About how we were all full of shit.
> But he wouldn't say why,
> He just kept on repeating it,
> That and the part about Russia and China
> And communist dupes, and I'll have to confess
> That I got a bit angry and told him to stuff his ideas up his ass,
> Which you don't have to tell me is hardly a way
> To convince anyone in an argument.
>
> Then he got salty and threatened to give me
> A punch in the mouth if I didn't shut up,
> And I really got hot,
> And the others did too,
> And we all beat the shit out of mister conservative.
> And, after all, he had only himself to be blamed.
> This is still a free country,
> And anyone telling a fellow like me,
> "Brother, you're full of shit",
> Better be good and ready
> To answer politely
> When asked if he'd care to say why.

Phillip Mispagel wrote:
> I can't see how those two are linked at all.  Public school and church are completely different.
>   
.
An under-educated populace, incapable of critical thinking, feeds 
churches well, which is what we're seeing now with the growth of the 
Evangelical Movement, as a direct result of the past 25 years we spent 
on a concerted, across the board effort to dismantle our public school 
system.

This used to be one of my old .sig lines:

> "There aren't a lot of thing in this world that one can be sure of,
> but I do know this; anytime you go by a church that's filled to the
> rafters with people you can be sure that the vast majority of them
> haven't read The Bible, because if they had, that church would be
> nearly empty."
Try reading The Bible, Koran, or any of these ancient mystical texts, 
sometime. They're mostly gibberish. This is one of the better 
descriptions of what I'm talking about http://tinyurl.com/fg9ep that 
I've ever read.

Shitty Schools = Full Churches

~Nyc

Subject: Re: [sfraves] (nrr) QOD (Mon)

There's a old family heirloom, that I've been promised, that's been in 
my family since about the time of the American Civil War, or some time 
before that, that's a unique military award, that was given to one of my 
ancestors by a Prussian King.

This relative of mine was supposed to *not* engage the enemy in a 
certain battle, but he went ahead and disobeyed that particular order 
and won the battle, which as it it turns out, was a decisive one, so 
instead of being relieved of duty and being sent to the brig, to be made 
an example of, he got the award instead.

As far as what Joint Chief of Staff USMC General Pace says in the QOD 
below goes, it sounds real good, and everybody from a 2nd Looie, on up, 
will utter some variant of it to those below them, but the practical 
reality for the ground pounding grunt, the one that's stuck having to 
follow the order, is that even after the smoke clears, and the dust 
settles, good luck getting anyone to see your side of it.

For every Jessica Lynch that testifies before Congress about military 
malfeasance, there are thousands of stories that will never see the 
light of day.
~

First stopped by Peter's for the crab feed w. Marco (Peter & Marco both played some badass house sets, btw). 

Next, went to the El Circco (sp?) party on Saturday off ILL. We were going to stop by Rooz's party too, but didn't have time. EC was totally badass! The party was pretty-much packed all night, vibe was in full effect, and the DJ's were tight. Not my genre, but sometimes I guess it's good to step out of the box a little. 

peace
CKG

yea the visuals were cool, especially in the smaller rooms with lots of
 black light stuff goin on & lights. i expected more in the main room
 but it wasnt as dark in there either. I think cuz it was the civic
 center it just doesnt have the same feel, but the bathrooms were clean!
  having the large main room was nice, i could go up and watch from the
 balcony or chill on the floor. stupid idiots walking around smoking
 ciggerettes tho.
  overall it was cool, but naaa not worth the money! (i paid $55).
 coudlnt believe how many ppl were standing in line to buy their tickets at
 the door for $75

> balcony or chill on the floor. stupid idiots walking around smoking
> ciggerettes tho.
> overall it was cool, but naaa not worth the money! (i paid $55).
> coudlnt believe how many ppl were standing in line to buy their tickets at
> the door for $75

From: Anthony Henin <wombat@panix.com>

Subject: [sfraves] Give Life and Get Funky, Sunday, Aug 5, 1-5pm

--Apple-Mail-87--779468637
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=UTF-8;
	delsp=yes;
	format=flowed

Folks,

Please circulate this to your communities.  Every donation makes a =20
difference.

Peace,  Anthony

---

Folks,

Here's some more information about the Blood Drive and Funkification =20
happening Sunday at 7th Heaven in Berkeley.  Though you CAN just drop =20=

in to give blood, it's better for the Red Cross folks if you make an =20
appointment online (see below), so they know roughly how many folks =20
to expect.

I would STRONGLY RECOMMEND that you have a good-sized meal before =20
coming in to donate.  It will keep your stomach settled.
Northern California blood banks are chronically short of blood, more =20
so than in the rest of the country.  Your donation can make a big =20
difference.  I have given blood every six weeks for the last few =20
years, and I feel it's a great way to contribute to the community.

As has been noted, homosexual males aren't eligible to give blood.  =20
This is determined by the FDA, NOT the Red Cross, so please don't let =20=

this affect your support of the organization.  Also, the Red Cross =20
does not test for the presence of alcohol or other stimulants/=20
depressants when you give blood. Check out the Bay Area Red Cross =20
website at http://www.bayarea-redcross.org/ for more information =20
about donating, as well is information about volunteering and CPR/=20
First Aid training.

Please join us, even if you can't (or can't bear to) give blood.  You =20=

can still help out by making a donation (by cash or check) to the Red =20=

Cross, and you can still...

---

...get your groove on before or after donating.  There will be two =20
waves or cycles to the dance:

1:00-3:00 PM
A student of Shiva Rae, TaraKali presents a Yoga Trance Dance - an =20
exploration of the eternal flow of natural movement through yoga.  =20
Beginning with Sahaja prana yoga or the experience of prana =20
initiating yogasanas, yoga trance dance flows into liberating breath =20
guided free-form movement to activate ones creative life force and =20
cultivate embodied freedom.

3:00-4:30 PM
DJ Betty Ray continues the journey with a freeform dance, busting out =20=

some new tracks and funky foot-stompin=E2=80=99 Sunday summertime =20
celebration goodness.

---

PLEASE FORWARD THIS WIDELY.  Every donation makes a difference.

Peace,  Anthony



=09





Announcing your next Blood Drive
Date :	8/5/2007 from 1:00 PM to 5:00 PM
Location :	7th Heaven Yoga
Yoga Studio
2820 7th St (2.5 blocks North of Ashby)

Berkeley, CA 94710
Make an Appointment :	Click Here
Directions and Notes :


What do I have to do :
Making an appointment is easy.

Click on the link above or below. Once you get to the website enter =20
your email address and date of birth. If you have used the online =20
appointment system before your information will display for your =20
approval. If you have not used our online system before you can fill =20
out the form with some basic information that the blood bank will need.

Then click the "Continue and View Blood Drives" button. You will see =20
our blood drive. If you went to the site without using the link and =20
don't see our drive enter 7YOGA where it asks for the sponsor code. =20
Click the circle to the left of the day you would like your =20
appointment. On the next page, pick a time. Then you will receive an =20
email confirming your appointment.

Click Here now to make your appointment! You are going to save a life!

Questions and Comments :
Site Coordinator :	Anthony Henin
wombat@panix.com

If you have been told previously by the American Red Cross or another =20=

blood center that you should never donate blood, please disregard =20
this message. If you recently made a blood donation, or if you have =20
already scheduled an appointment to donate blood, please accept our =20
thanks on behalf of the patients whose lives you may have touched.

To donate blood you must be at least 17 years old, weigh 110 lbs. and =20=

be in good health.


=EF=BF=BC
=C2=A9 1998-2007 eDonorTM. All rights reserved.

class=3D"Apple-style-span" style=3D"border-spacing: 2px 2px; font-size: =
11px; ">Making an appointment is easy.</SPAN></P><P =
style=3D"border-spacing: 2px 2px; font-size: 11px; "><SPAN =
class=3D"Apple-style-span" style=3D"border-spacing: 2px 2px; font-size: =
11px; ">Click on the link above or below. Once you get to the website =
enter your email address and date of birth. If you have used the online =
appointment system before your information will display for your =
approval. If you have not used our online system before you can fill out =
the form with some basic information that the blood bank will =
need.</SPAN></P><P style=3D"border-spacing: 2px 2px; font-size: 11px; =
"><SPAN class=3D"Apple-style-span" style=3D"border-spacing: 2px 2px; =
font-size: 11px; ">Then click the "Continue and View Blood Drives" =
button. You will see our blood drive. If you went to the site without =
using the link and don't see our drive enter </SPAN><STRONG =
style=3D"border-spacing: 2px 2px; font-size: 11px; font-weight: bold; =
"><SPAN class=3D"Apple-style-span" style=3D"border-spacing: 2px 2px; =
font-size: 11px; font-weight: bold; ">7YOGA</SPAN></STRONG><SPAN =
class=3D"Apple-style-span" style=3D"border-spacing: 2px 2px; font-size: =
11px; "> where it asks for the sponsor code. Click the circle to the =
left of the day you would like your appointment. On the next page, pick =
a time. Then you will receive an email confirming your =
appointment.</SPAN></P><P style=3D"border-spacing: 2px 2px; font-size: =
11px; "><A href=3D"https://www.givelife.org/index.cfm?Sponsor=3D7YOGA"><SP=

underline; ">Click Here</SPAN></A><SPAN class=3D"Apple-style-span" =
style=3D"border-spacing: 2px 2px; font-size: 11px; "> now to make your =
appointment! You are going to save a life!</SPAN></P></TD></TR><TR =

Whatever is unnamed, undepicted in images, whatever is omitted from
biography, censored in collections of letters, whatever is misnamed as
something else, made difficult-to-come-by, whatever is buried in the
memory by the collapse of meaning under an inadequate or lying
language -- this will become not merely unspoken, but unspeakable.

- Adrienne Rich

Galen (sunset/pacific sound, tweekin')

Worthy (dirtybird, katabatic)

Syd Gris (opel productions)

Leonard (inhouse, tocadisco) 

Sen-Sei & Andrew Phelan (prismatic, eight-tracks, lingo)

Eric Sharp (rock it science, minx thursdays)

Rouzbeh (back 2 basics)

The Fingermonsters (cubik, origami, andrew Phelan, shawn allen)

Audio Angel (myspace.com/audioangel)

Michael Anthony (supperclub)

Sharon Buck (green gorilla lounge)

Michael Tello (om, gest, mvp)

Jimmy B. (rxfx, green gorilla lounge)

An update on this, Mike Ruppert claims he may have been poisoned, you  
can find on his website the whole story.  I generally feel the same  
way as him, though, I am not really that important.  6 billion other  
people.

May we all survive until 2012 when the earth's axis tilts and everyone  
except those that are buying my products will meet their fate.

--

The question I am asked most frequently at lectures is why I haven't
been killed yet.  I have two answers.  First, it is not
cost-effective, and the response would cause more problems than it
would solve.  I am not important enough to kill.

Secondly, I will not die one minute before God has decided.

- Michael Ruppert, "Crossing the Rubicon"
